page.title: 04THE ARMY ON DARTMOOR
page.content: Much of Dartmoor is used for Military training, Okehampton Battle Camp was once a large and busier place than it is today. There is no standing body of soldiers, but a succession of visiting units of mostly army and marine personnel, come to train in the wild landscape. Such training is said to have been an important factor in the Falklands, where the territory is similar. It is common to find groups of blackened faces in camouflage roaming about with radios crackling. Sometimes the silence of the moor is broken by the drone of helicopters. Firing is only carried out on certain days when civilians are not allowed on the ranges, red flags flying to warn of the danger. See next page for details of firing notices.
